BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE YOUNG PEOPLE'S CHORUS OF NEW YORK

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE CHILDREN OF DIVERSE ABILITIES AND ETHNIC BACKGROUNDS WITH A UNIQUE PROGRAM OF MUSIC APPRECIATION AND CHORAL PERFORMANCE THAT SEEKS TO FULFILL EACH CHILD'S MUSICAL POTENTIAL, WHILE CREATING A MODEL OF ARTISTIC EXCELLENCE AND HARMONY THAT ENRICHES OUR COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE CHILDREN OF DIVERSE ABILITIES AND ETHNIC BACKGROUNDS WITH A UNIQUE PROGRAM OF MUSIC APPRECIATION AND CHORAL PERFORMANCE THAT SEEKS TO FULFILL EACH CHILD'S MUSICAL POTENTIAL, WHILE CREATING A MODEL OF ARTISTIC EXCELLENCE AND HARMONY THAT ENRICHES OUR COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: THE YOUNG PEOPLE'S CHORUS PROVIDES A COMPREHENSIVE KNOWLEDGE OF MUSIC TO APPROXIMATELY 2,255 BOYS AND GIRLS.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PERMANENT ENDOWMENT FUND IS TO BE EXPENDED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, CHORAL LITERACY, PERFORMANCE AND NEW COMMISSIONS PROGRAMS, AND TO GROW THE ENDOWMENT. THE BOARD-DESIGNATED ENDOWMENT AND THE TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT ARE TO FURTHER OR CARRY OUT THE CHARITABLE PURPOSES OF THE ORGANIZATION.

THE ORGANIZATION IS GENERALLY EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE ORGANIZATION BELIEVES THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII -188,573.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FRANCISCO, HOWARD, AND ELIZABETH NUNEZ ARE RELATED PARTIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE 990 WAS REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION AND THEN FORWARDED TO THE TREASURER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD REVIEWS COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS IN A CLOSED BOARD MEETING WITHOUT STAFF OR THE PRESIDENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
OVERSIGHT, REVIEW AND SELECTION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: CHANGE IN NET ASSETS FROM OPERATING ACTIVITIES- UNRESTRICTED
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THE CHANGE IN UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS FROM OPERATING ACTIVITIES BEFORE DEPRECIATION EXPENSE & UNCOLLECTIBLE ACCOUNTS WAS APPROXIMATELY ($6,000) AND $417,000 RESPECTIVELY. THE ORGANIZATION'S DEPRECIATION EXPENSE WAS APPROXIMATELY $193,000 AND $166,000 FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, RESPECTIVELY. THE ORGANIZATION'S UNCOLLECTIBLE ACCOUNTS WERE APPROXIMATELY $73,000 AND $0 FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, RESPECTIVELY. THE ORGANIZATION'S CHANGE IN UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS AFTER DEPRECIATION & UNCOLLECTIBLE ACCOUNTS WAS APPROXIMATELY ($199,000) AND $251,000 FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, RESPECTIVELY.
